CROSSOVER.description:
CROSSOVER specifies if rates are to be crossed over to another consumer if rate capacity is exceeded. If the energy consumption calculation is not successful for a consumer, and the consumer has a valid cross-over defined, the consumer will be allocated its maximum rate and the exceeding rate will be added to the cross-over consumer.
To avoid loops, a consumer can only be either receiving or giving away rate. For a cross-over to be valid, the discharge pressure at the consumer "receiving" overshooting rate must be higher than or equal to the discharge pressure of the "sending" consumer. This is because it is possible to choke pressure down to meet the outlet pressure in a flow line with lower pressure, but not possible to "pressure up" in the crossover flow line.
Some examples show how the crossover logic works:
Crossover is given as and list of integer values for the first position is the first consumer, second position is the second consumer, etc. The number specifies which consumer to send cross-over flow to, and 0 signifies no cross-over possible. Note that we use 1-index here.
Example 1:
Two consumers where there is a cross-over such that if the rate for the first consumer exceeds its capacity, the excess rate will be processed by the second consumer. The second consumer can not cross-over to anyone.
CROSSOVER: 
  - FROM: consumer1 
    TO: consumer2 
Example 2:
The first and second consumers may both send exceeding rate to the third consumer if their capacity is exceeded.
CROSSOVER: 
  - FROM: consumer1 
    TO: consumer3 
  - FROM: consumer2 
    TO: consumer3
CROSSOVER.title: Crossover

FILE.description:
Specifies the name of an input file.

$ECALC_DOCS_KEYWORDS_URL/FILE
FILE.title: FILE

ADJUSTMENT.description:
Definition of adjustments to correct for mismatches in facility energy usage.

$ECALC_DOCS_KEYWORDS_URL/ADJUSTMENT
ADJUSTMENT.title: ADJUSTMENT

TYPE.description:
Defines the type of model applied on the data in the file.

$ECALC_DOCS_KEYWORDS_URL/TYPE
TYPE.title: TYPE

NAME.description: Name of variable. Must correspond exactly to header/column name in the energy function
NAME.title: NAME

TYPE.description: The type of the component
TYPE.title: Type

NAME.description: Name of the model. See documentation for more information.
NAME.title: NAME

TYPE.description: Defines the type of model. See documentation for more information.
TYPE.title: TYPE

LOWER_HEATING_VALUE.description: Lower heating value [MJ/Sm3] of fuel. Lower heating value is also known as net calorific value
LOWER_HEATING_VALUE.title: LOWER_HEATING_VALUE

TURBINE_LOADS.description: Load values [MW] in load vs efficiency table for turbine. Number of elements must correspond to number of elements in TURBINE_EFFICIENCIES. See documentation for more information.
TURBINE_LOADS.title: TURBINE_LOADS

TURBINE_EFFICIENCIES.description: Efficiency values in load vs efficiency table for turbine. Efficiency is given as fraction between 0 and 1 corresponding to 0-100%. Number of elements must correspond to number of elements in TURBINE_LOADS. See documentation for more information.
TURBINE_EFFICIENCIES.title: TURBINE_EFFICIENCIES

POWER_ADJUSTMENT_CONSTANT.description: Constant to adjust power usage in MW
POWER_ADJUSTMENT_CONSTANT.title: POWER_ADJUSTMENT_CONSTANT

POWER_ADJUSTMENT_FACTOR.description: Factor to adjust power usage in MW
POWER_ADJUSTMENT_FACTOR.title: POWER_ADJUSTMENT_FACTOR

RATE.description: Unit for rate in compressor chart. Currently only AM3_PER_HOUR is supported
RATE.title: RATE

HEAD.description: Unit for head in compressor chart. Supported units are M, KJ_PER_KG, JOULE_PER_KG
HEAD.title: HEAD

EFFICIENCY.description: Unit of efficiency in compressor chart. Supported units are PERCENTAGE and FRACTION.
EFFICIENCY.title: EFFICIENCY

MAXIMUM_PRESSURE_RATIO_PER_STAGE.description: Maximum pressure ratio per stage. Number of compressors will be large enough to ensure no pressure ratios are above a given maximum pressure ratio per stage, but not larger
MAXIMUM_PRESSURE_RATIO_PER_STAGE.title: MAXIMUM_PRESSURE_RATIO_PER_STAGE

INLET_TEMPERATURE.description: Inlet temperature in Celsius for stage
INLET_TEMPERATURE.title: INLET_TEMPERATURE

COMPRESSOR_CHART.description: Reference to compressor chart model for stage, must be defined in MODELS or FACILITY_INPUTS
COMPRESSOR_CHART.title: COMPRESSOR_CHART

NAME.description: Name of the model. See documentation for more information.
NAME.title: NAME

TYPE.description: Defines the type of model. See documentation for more information.
TYPE.title: TYPE

CURVES.description: Compressor chart curves, one per speed.
CURVES.title: CURVES

NAME.description: Name of the model. See documentation for more information.
NAME.title: NAME

MAXIMUM_POWER.description: Optional constant MW maximum power the compressor train can require
MAXIMUM_POWER.title: MAXIMUM_POWER

TYPE.description: Defines the type of model. See documentation for more information.
TYPE.title: TYPE

CALCULATE_MAX_RATE.description: Optional compressor train max standard rate [Sm3/day] in result if set to true. Default false. Use with caution. This will increase runtime significantly.
CALCULATE_MAX_RATE.title: CALCULATE_MAX_RATE

POWER_ADJUSTMENT_CONSTANT.description: Constant to adjust power usage in MW
POWER_ADJUSTMENT_CONSTANT.title: POWER_ADJUSTMENT_CONSTANT

POWER_ADJUSTMENT_FACTOR.description: Factor to adjust power usage in MW
POWER_ADJUSTMENT_FACTOR.title: POWER_ADJUSTMENT_FACTOR

NAME.description: Name of the model. See documentation for more information.
NAME.title: NAME

MAXIMUM_POWER.description: Optional constant MW maximum power the compressor train can require
MAXIMUM_POWER.title: MAXIMUM_POWER

TYPE.description: Defines the type of model. See documentation for more information.
TYPE.title: TYPE

STREAMS.description: A list of all in- and out-going streams for the compressor train. The same equation of state (EOS) must be used for each INGOING stream fluid models
STREAMS.title: STREAMS

STAGES.description: A list of all stages in compressor model.
STAGES.title: STAGES

POWER_ADJUSTMENT_CONSTANT.description: Constant to adjust power usage in MW
POWER_ADJUSTMENT_CONSTANT.title: POWER_ADJUSTMENT_CONSTANT

POWER_ADJUSTMENT_FACTOR.title: POWER_ADJUSTMENT_FACTOR

EMISSIONS.description: The emission types and volume-emission-factors associated with oil loading/storage
